text.section: This section applies only in Anne Arundel County.

The State's Attorney's salary:
for calendar year 2003, is equal to the salary of a circuit court judge as of December 31, 2002; and
shall be increased each calendar year thereafter by 3% over the salary of the State's Attorney for the previous calendar year.

section.section:
Subject to approval by the administrative judge of the circuit court, the State's Attorney may:
appoint a temporary assistant State's Attorney for a particular case or series of cases; and
subject to the approval of the county, set the compensation for the temporary assistant State's Attorney.

text.section: The State's Attorney may appoint clerical, administrative, investigative, and other staff the State's Attorney considers necessary for the proper conduct of the office.

section.section: Except in connection with performing the duties of the office, the State's Attorney may not appear as counsel or represent any party before a court or unit of the State or a political subdivision of the State.
The State's Attorney may not engage in the private practice of law.
The deputy State's Attorneys shall serve full time and may not engage in the private practice of criminal law.

Subject to paragraph (4) of this subsection, the assistant State's Attorneys:
may not engage in the private practice of criminal law; and
except for one assistant State's Attorney, shall serve full time.
In accordance with the Anne Arundel County Code, the State's Attorney may designate two or more assistant State's Attorneys to share one or more full-time positions.
